newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - June 9.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - June 9.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sri Lankan press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
President Chandrika Kumaratunga plans changes to the cabinet portfolios of media, labour, health, fisheries, housing and transport in a reshuffle to be announced on Monday.
Opposition leader and former prime minister Ranil Wickremesinghe leaves on 10-day tour of Britain.
Security forces, pushing deeper into Tamil rebel-held Wanni region, capture the village of Panikeniravi just south of the fortified rebel-held town of Puliyankulam.
More than 90 Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE) rebels killed in heavy fighting over the weekend as security forces advance deeper into the rebel-controlled Wanni region, military officials say.
A $70 million programme assisted by the World Bank and Asian Development Bank to improve teacher training to get underway shortly, Education Ministry says.
At least three deputy ministesr are expected to be elevated to the rank of a cabinet minister in a reshuffle to be announced by President Kumaratunga on Monday.
